data.title: WCRMC Washington County Regional Medical Center: About
data.text:
For 58 years Washington County Regional Medical Center has provided high quality, patient centered care to the community. The very first patients were admitted to the hospital on August 25, 1961. We are a licensed general acute care 56-bed hospital with a 60-bed extended care facility. The hospital provides comprehensive inpatient and outpatient surgery, along with a 24-hour physician staffed emergency room. We offer a wide scope of services including an Imaging Center, Rehabilitation Services (Occupational Therapy, Physical Therapy, Speech Therapy, and Wound Care), Respiratory Therapy, Cardiac Rehabilitation, Swing-Bed, Inpatient and Outpatient Surgery, ICU, Telemedicine, Lab, and Ambulance Services. We also operate a Pediatric Clinic, Sleep Center, Family Practice and a Specialty Clinic offering Cardiac and Orthopedic Services.

Washington County Regional Medical Center is committed to providing our diverse patient population with the highest quality care. Our hospital services patients from 5 counties. We are consistently growing and adding services to enhance the healthcare in our area. Washington County Regional Medical Center’s mission is to be instrumental in our community’s health and happiness.

Known as the “Kaolin Capital of the World”, Washington county has all the benefits of a larger town, with a small-town feel. Home to a Georgia Military College satellite campus and Oconee Fall Line Technical College, the area is rich with opportunity. With a diverse, and close-knit population of just over 20,000 people, a thriving downtown, an active community, and a rich history, Washington county has something for everyone. Washington county is an area steeped in tradition. A short stroll amongst the historic streets will give a glimpse into what life was like hundreds of years ago.

The varied industries including, agriculture, mining, timber, manufacturing, transportation, education and healthcare offer residents many different career paths. A healthy amount of community pride, flourishing local economy, and general sense of warmth are common throughout the area. Centrally located within 2 hours of Atlanta, Savannah, Macon and Augusta, Washington county offers residents a diverse economic base, quality education, welcoming atmosphere, and deep historic roots that make this an ideal community to work and live.
